back: Given $n$-vectors $\mathbf{x}$ and $\mathbf{y}$, the dot product or inner product is denoted $\mathbf{x} \cdot \mathbf{y}$ or $\mathbf{x}^T \mathbf{y}$ and is the scalar value given by multiplying corresponding components and summing them up: \begin{equation*} \mathbf{x} \cdot \mathbf{y} = \sum_{i=0}^{n-1} x_i y_i. \end{equation*}
